intro: Hippocratea tenuiflora f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hippocratea, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
